titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Gilman (1897-1958) received her bachelor's degree from Bryn Mawr in 1919 and her Ph.D. in 1924. She taught at Bryn Mawr from 1923 to 1958.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains the typed and copy edited manuscript of Gilman's 1958 The Idea of Poetry in France. There is also a typed manuscript of Les Fleurs du Mal from 1957 and correspondence regarding an address that Gilman gave at Longwood Gardens, in Kennett Square, Pennsylvania . Also included is a folder of sympathy cards and some personal memorabilia, including commemorative medals from the 1900 Exposition in Paris.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
